           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>Overall, this issue is very similar to <span class="line"><!---->Overall, this issue is very similar to <!----></span>issue 1212498<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1212498" title="Security: UAF after user clicks help link in enhanced spell check dialog"><!---->issue 1212498<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<!----></span><br>2. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->2. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<!----></span><br>4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<span class="line"><!---->4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<!----></span><br>5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<span class="line"><!---->5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<!----></span><br>6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<span class="line"><!---->6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<span class="line"><!---->The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<span class="line"><!---->When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<span class="line"><!---->If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<!----></span><br><br>The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is present there as well.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is present there as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>Overall, this issue is very similar to <span class="line"><!---->Overall, this issue is very similar to <!----></span>issue 1212498<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1212498" title="Security: UAF after user clicks help link in enhanced spell check dialog"><!---->issue 1212498<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<!----></span><br>2. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->2. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<!----></span><br>4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<span class="line"><!---->4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<!----></span><br>5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<span class="line"><!---->5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<!----></span><br>6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<span class="line"><!---->6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<span class="line"><!---->The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<span class="line"><!---->When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<span class="line"><!---->If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<!----></span><br><br>The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is present there as well.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is present there as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        For what it's worth, this reproduces for me on the current version of each release channel (stable, beta, dev and canary). Also, it doesn't look like there have been any relevant changes to the AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel recently:<span class="line"><!---->For what it's worth, this reproduces for me on the current version of each release channel (stable, beta, dev and canary). Also, it doesn't look like there have been any relevant changes to the AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel recently:<!----></span><br><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/main/chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/main/chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/main/chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc<!----></a><br><br>So it appears this issue may have been around for some time. Testing on an older asan build (85.0.4177.0, from about a year ago) also shows the same use-after-free (I've attached the asan log for that build here).<span class="line"><!---->So it appears this issue may have been around for some time. Testing on an older asan build (85.0.4177.0, from about a year ago) also shows the same use-after-free (I've attached the asan log for that build here).<!----></span><br><br>vakh@ Does the tab the extension creates close after you select one of the options under the accessibility menu? The extension will only close the tab if the time between opening the context menu and showing the dialog is less than 10 seconds.<span class="line"><!---->vakh@ Does the tab the extension creates close after you select one of the options under the accessibility menu?         Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>comment 7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->comment 7<!----></a>, does it matter that BrowserList::GetInstance()->GetLastActive() might return a different profile than the one used to pull up the dialog? I’m working on related <span class="line"><!---->, does it matter that BrowserList::GetInstance()-&gt;GetLastActive() might return a different profile than the one used to pull up the dialog? I’m working on related <!----></span>issue 1212498<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1212498" title="Security: UAF after user clicks help link in enhanced spell check dialog"><!---->issue 1212498<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> I think I might have to just close the dialog if the page closes out from underneath it.<span class="line"><!----> I think I might have to just close the dialog if the page closes out from underneath it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <!---->
        
      </div><br>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <div class="select-container">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)

        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>Overall, this issue is very similar to <span class="line"><!---->Overall, this issue is very similar to <!----></span>issue 1212498<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1212498" title="Security: UAF after user clicks help link in enhanced spell check dialog"><!---->issue 1212498<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<!----></span><br>2. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->2. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<!----></span><br>4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<span class="line"><!---->4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<!----></span><br>5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<span class="line"><!---->5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<!----></span><br>6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<span class="line"><!---->6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<span class="line"><!---->The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<span class="line"><!---->When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<span class="line"><!---->If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<!----></span><br><br>The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is present there as well.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is present there as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>Overall, this issue is very similar to <span class="line"><!---->Overall, this issue is very similar to <!----></span>issue 1212498<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1212498" title="Security: UAF after user clicks help link in enhanced spell check dialog"><!---->issue 1212498<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<!----></span><br>2. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->2. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<!----></span><br>4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<span class="line"><!---->4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<!----></span><br>5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<span class="line"><!---->5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<!----></span><br>6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<span class="line"><!---->6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<span class="line"><!---->The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<span class="line"><!---->When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<span class="line"><!---->If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<!----></span><br><br>The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is present there as well.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is present there as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 7<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212500#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        For what it's worth, this reproduces for me on the current version of each release channel (stable, beta, dev and canary). Also, it doesn't look like there have been any relevant changes to the AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel recently:<span class="line"><!---->For what it's worth, this reproduces for me on the current version of each release channel (stable, beta, dev and canary). Also, it doesn't look like there have been any relevant changes to the AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel recently:<!----></span><br><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/main/chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/main/chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/main/chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc<!----></a><br><br>So it appears this issue may have been around for some time. Testing on an older asan build (85.0.4177.0, from about a year ago) also shows the same use-after-free (I've attached the asan log for that build here).<span class="line"><!---->So it appears this issue may have been around for some time.         This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 23, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog includes a help link in the bottom left. That link is opened via the WebContents used to show the dialog. If that WebContents has been destroyed (e.g. because the tab has been closed) and the user clicks the help link, a UAF will occur in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>Overall, this issue is very similar to <span class="line"><!---->Overall, this issue is very similar to <!----></span>issue 1212498<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1212498" title="Security: UAF after user clicks help link in enhanced spell check dialog"><!---->issue 1212498<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 93.0.4520.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<span class="line"><!---->1. Navigate to chrome://accessibility/ and enable the "Web accessibility" and "Screen reader support" modes.<!----></span><br>2. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->2. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->3. Once installed, the extension will open page.html in a new tab.<!----></span><br>4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<span class="line"><!---->4. Right-click anywhere on the page, then select one of the options under the "Get image descriptions from Google" submenu.<!----></span><br>5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<span class="line"><!---->5. page.html will wait for the contextmenu event, followed by a blur event (which will be triggered when the accessibility labels dialog is opened). Once it detects those events, it will send a message to the background page requesting it to close the tab.<!----></span><br>6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<span class="line"><!---->6. Once the tab has been closed, click the help link shown in the dialog. That will result in a UAF in the browser process. You can verify that by going through these steps in an asan build.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<span class="line"><!---->The AccessibilityLabelsBubbleModel class holds a pointer to the WebContents that was used to host the context menu:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.h;l=41;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<span class="line"><!---->When the help page link is clicked, the stored WebContents will be used to open the help page:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/renderer_context_menu/accessibility_labels_bubble_model.cc;l=99;drc=dec9912407fc5946125799ec62b996a04d08c4f0<!----></a><br><br>If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<span class="line"><!---->If the WebContents has been destroyed since the menu was shown, that will result in a UAF.<!----></span><br><br>The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<span class="line"><!---->The accessibility labels dialog can also be invoked via chrome://settings/accessibility:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/accessibility_main_handler.cc;l=71;drc=d6a9b7daec08caaa914942f6be2c864e54904d70<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is present there as well.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is present there as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Are we sure the profile will still be valid, too? This might have been the last window that had the profile open, and I know there are efforts to close out profiles when they’re done being used.<span class="line"><!---->Are we sure the profile will still be valid, too? before using to open new tab.<!----></span><br><br>This means if the web contents were invalidated or missing, we can<span class="line"><!---->This means if the web contents were invalidated or missing, we can<!----></span><br>still open the help page for the dialog about showing image<span class="line"><!---->still open the help page for the dialog about showing image<!----></span><br>descriptions for unlabeled images, but without using invalid memory.<span class="line"><!---->descriptions for unlabeled images, but without using invalid memory.<!----></span><br><br>Also removes outdated TODO and adds a test for<span class="line"><!---->Also removes outdated TODO and adds a test         This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), marinakz@(ChromeOS), pbommana@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * is disabled for this component.

        for LitElement.

              Discard
            </chops-button>

          </div>
        </form>
      </chops-dialog>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
